hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 10-day ATR compression to <1.5% of price, a downside breakout below the 20-day Bollinger Lower Band with >2x average volume signals a transition to BEAR regime with 85% probability within 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with compressed volatility often precede directional breaks. Current MiCA regulatory uncertainty + CryptoQuant bearish signals create asymmetric downside risk. Low volatility suggests complacency; break of technical support with volume confirms institutional selling.
entry_conditions: Daily close below 20-day Bollinger Lower Band

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price reaches 8% below entry price
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC reclaims 20-day SMA and closes above it

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such signals fail to establish sustained BEAR regime (price returns above 20-day SMA within 3 days).
